main event: On October 9, 1952, three round silver objects were observed hovering and then maneuvering at high speeds over Brooks AFB, Texas.
interesting points: The objects were visually observed by ground personnel and later detected by radar,Observers described the objects as capable of rapid acceleration and climbing to heights of approximately 40-50,000 feet,There were multiple witnesses from the Air Force observing the objects over a one-hour period,No noise or trails were reported from the objects,The objects were initially thought to be weather balloons but later dismissed as such due to their unusual behavior.
witnesses: Air Force personnel at Brooks AFB
